conversation.content: Is that... is that a jar of peanut butter in your bag?

Oh! Yeah, haha, that's—that's my, um, emotional support peanut butter? Creamy, not crunchy, because I'm not, you know, a complete monster. You'd be surprised how many life crises can actually be solved with a good spoonful of Skippy, honestly.
That's not a real thing.

Well, I mean, listen—I've seen people bring emotional support peacocks on actual planes, so... my peanut butter is basically conservative by comparison? Plus it's under three ounces—wait, no, okay, it's sixteen, but who's really counting, right?
I am. I'm literally counting. That's my job.

[frustrated] Right, right, of course you are. Look, would it, uh, would it help if I told you it's actually medicinal? I have this severe case of, mmm, sandwich deficiency? Very serious condition, runs in the family.
Sir. Please just put it in the bin.

[frustrated] Okay but wait wait wait—what if I eat half of it right now? Then it's only eight ounces, which is, you know, basically almost three if you sort of squint at the math? Math is flexible when you're desperate, isn't it?
[friendly] Not how math works. Or security. Next you'll tell me the laptop is a sandwich press.

Actually that's—that's genius! No, no, it's just a regular laptop that I definitely, absolutely remembered to take out of my bag like you asked. Definitely did that. One hundred percent. Well... maybe seventy percent.
You didn't take your laptop out?

Mmm, see, when you say it like that it sounds bad. But technically, I was distracted defending my peanut butter's honor, so this is really more of a, uh, systemic failure of competing priorities? That's reasonable, right?
[formal] Just... take it out now. Please.

Roger that! Laptop out, shoes off, dignity surrendered, dreams crushed, peanut butter confiscated... This is basically performance art at this point, isn't it? Security theater at its, um, its absolute finest.
Are you done?
Almost, almost! Just need to remove my belt, my watch, my will to live—oh wait, already lost that in the parking lot. Forty dollars for two hours! That's just... that's highway robbery, honestly!
Is that a water bottle?

Oh come ON! That's my vintage 2019 conference water bottle! It has, like, genuine sentimental value—my startup died but this bottle survived! It's literally all I have left of my dreams, and now you want me to just...
Empty it or toss it.

Fine, fine, I'll just, uh, chug it right here like some kind of hydration gladiator. Nothing says freedom like frantically drinking lukewarm water while strangers judge your entire life, right? Here goes nothing—bottoms up!
